title: Formula for the the Angular Momentum
text: Angular momentum is given by $$L=I \omega$$ where I is the moment of inertia of an object about an axis and ω is its angular velocity about that axis.

title: Calculate the Moment of Inertia of Earth in Its Orbit
text: The Earth can be treated as a point mass orbiting the Sun, so the moment of inertia is $$I=m^{r^2}$$ where $$m$$ is the mass of the Earth, approximately 5.97×10**24 kg, $$r$$ is the average distance from the Earth to the Sun, approximately 1.496×10**11 $$m$$. What is I?

title: Find the Angular Velocity in $$\frac{rad}{s}$$
text: The Earth completes one revolution around the Sun in approximately one year $$(365.25$$ $$days=31557600$$ second). Use the formula ω=2pi​/T for the angular velocity.

title: Calculate the Angular Momentum
text: Now, substitute the values of I and ω to find the angular momentum $$L=I \omega$$ in $$\frac{kg m^2}{s}$$.
